column4: my ubuntu dapper server locked up at about 12:30 am this morning. Are there any logs I can check?
start with /var/log - do an ls -latr there to see the most often written ones
what am I looking for?
i don't know - mostly what was happening when the sys locked up - you are on a treasure hunt  :)
depending on the cause, you might see nothing that helps
are ther entries after you know it 'locked up'?
if so then you will need to narrow your definition of 'locked up'
well, the machine locked up at 12:30 am this morning. that's 00:30 here. The last entry I have before that time is yesterday at 15:21
starting with the udev log
no logs altered after that time?? hmm - there should atleast be a heartbeat in messages
lines that look like:               Jan 26 11:18:21 localhost -- MARK --
normally every half hour
those would be in the actual logs, right?
in the log file NAMED messages
how do i view the logs? in a text editor? can't I grep them somehow?
they are conventional text files - all the tools in linux that work on text files can be used
and what is the best way to grep those files?
the best way to grep a text file is with grep.  I do not understand the question.
you are on a treasure hunt - perusing the file with less, most or a text editor would be my choice
JaXxon instead of opening up the log in nano, how do I query the text file via cli? dmesg /var/log/messages | grep mark ?
pls join me in #ubuntu-classroom
